sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten lettercard from Moriz Schenker to Heinrich Schenker, dated November 24, 1930
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Moriz Schenker is working hard to speed up [mortgage formalities on the Arzberg property], and cannot meet the latest deadline that Heinrich has set him.

tei:opener.tei:salute: Meine Lieben!Receipt of this lettercard is recorded in Heinrich’s diary for November 25, 1930: “Von Mozio (Kartenbrief): bittet wieder um „Geduld“ . .” (“From Mozio (lettercard): he asks again for "patience" … .”).

tei:div.tei:p: Deine wiederholten Mahnungen u. DrohungenHeinrich’s diary for November 22, 1930 records the most recent of these: “An Mozio (K.): letzte Erinnerung.” (“To Mozio (postcard): last reminder.”). habe ich rechtzeitig bekommen. Leider kann ich den mir vorgeschriebenen Termin nicht einhalten, u. dies natürlich nicht durch meine Schuld sondern durch die langsamen Formalitäten.“langsamen Formalitäten” (“slow-moving formalities”): underlined in crayon by Heinrich. Ich arbeite unmenschlich um die Sache zu beschleunigen u. hoffe recht bald das Resultat zu haben. Bitte um Geduld!Subsequent events are recorded in Heinrich’s diary: December 11: “ Von Mozio (Br.): hat erst jetzt in Weyr urgirt!!! Wird bestimmt „einen größeren Betrag“ ausfolgen, den Rest will er in „festen Arrangements“ einhalten! ” (“From Mozio (letter): he has only now made urgent noises in Weyr!!! He will definitely hand over "a rather large sum"; the rest he will comply with in "fixed arrangements"!”), after which Schenker extends the deadline by a month through his attorney; January 27, 1931: “Von Sophie (Br.): erfuhr durch Julian, Mozios Lage sei traurig, er habe die Unterstützung eines Freundes in Anspruch nehmen müssen.” (“From Sophie (letter): she learned from Julian that Mozio’s situation was sorrowful; he had to avail himself of the support of a friend.”). — Schenker has been pestering Moriz since 1929 to return the asset that he invested in Moriz’s Arzberg property development. Heinrich’s diaries for 1931 to 1934 record Moriz’s mental deterioration, most dramatically the collapse of the Creditanstalt Bank in May 1931 (setting off the succession of bank collapses leading to European-wide depression), and trace a series of installments paid monthly between 1931 and 1934, but apparently still incomplete at the time of Schenker’s death in January 1935. Moriz himself committed suicide in 1936.

tei:address.tei:addrLine: To: Professor Dr Heinrich Schenker, Esq.

tei:div.tei:p: I have been receiving your repeated reminders and warnings punctually. Regrettably, I cannot adhere to the deadline that you have set me, and this is of course not through any fault of mine but because of the slow-moving formalities. I am working superhumanly to speed things up, and hope to get the result very soon.
